WRITING.TITLE: Apparently this stuff absorbs through everywhere...
WRITING.TEXT: Okay, basically. I rolled up 2 blotters and put them in me dick. I /read/ on here that apparently it won't absorb through the urethra and that it'd have to liquid and shit. Lies. All lies. I'm hella trippin. Trust yourself first, then the random internet people #8203; Short trip report: I put it in, and then felt that weird heavy lung feeling and was like "nahhh this cant be it... but it kinda feels like it". Shortly after i got the body feel and was like "okay, yeah, fuck this actually works" and already was rainbow-like figures appear when i close my eyes. I then proceeded to talk to my parents a bit and be on the PC talking to a friend. I had like slight complementary visuals, but nothing too groundbraking, since it was only 200ug. Closed eyes had a tiny bit going on but nothing special really. I later decided to vape a bit of weed, then shit went insane. I looked at my phone, to write my friend, and after looking at the screen and characters for a while, characters start appearing accross my vision in a big rainbow font that looked like it was made of thin metal like a samurai sword and the rainbow pattern was as if the font was rainbow due to it being so reflective. It looked really cool and i was like "wow... this is amazing!" I then like listened to music and ate the food my parents gave me, i told them i "wasn't feeling so well today" and they bought it. Closed eye visuals were very interesting and vivid. After taking a bong hit, i went to my car and started it. I felt every explosion happening in those 3 cylinders and revving the engine was amazing. I did a few minor things until i decided to take a big bong hit at 2 AM Big mistake, then things got messy in my brain and i was tired, that's when things got uncomfortable. I went to sleep and woke up, still a little out of tune, but i returned to normal after being high a few days.
Yes i just now created this account because only now do i really feel the need to talk on here.

WRITING.TITLE: [1P-LSD] Trip doesn't end until sleep
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, i don't know if this post was made before but i am very curious have found nothing so far on the internet. #8203; I have never actually tripped on actual LSD. I always just tripped on 1P-LSD with friends. We all noticed, that the trip never actually ends until we sleep. I had a trip going on for 18 hours and it's intensity didn't slow down ever since the 6 hour mark. Everyone always says "12 hours" is one trip but with my and my friends expierience it's weird. And the weirdest thing is, my bestie went to sleep at the 5 hour mark, WAS ABLE TO SLEEP, and then woke up 7 hours later completely normal again? #8203; Has anyone expierienced something similar or has any idea why this could be?

WRITING.TITLE: Smoked Syrian Rue + Vaped DMT Expierience
WRITING.TEXT: I feel like it's something that somebody surely must've posted here before, but i cannot find it. Anyways. I smoked a bit less than 1g of syrian rue seeds, which i beat up into powder in a big bowl prior, with my bong. It smells a bit less bad than burnt hair and tastes like nothing and maybe a bit bitter. Hurt in the lung a bit but generally easier to smoke than weed. After deciding to not smoke more i vaped my DMT with my dry herb vaporizer. You can do this with anything though i suppose. I put 50mg freebase in it. The trip lasted about 1 hour maybe more. In hindsight it didn't feel like my typical DMT expierience, where i take in as much as i can and peak and go back too quickly for my taste. It was more like the buzz of a joint, where every 20 minutes i'd take a lil puff to get a bit more buzzed again. But instead of being a cannabis buzz, it was a DMT buzz with visuals and everything. There was no rush. I was on different levels throughout the trip. At first i decided i wanted to go out and then met entities and also was taught something. Which i forgot ofc. Later i took more DMT and was only on a slight level. With alot of visuals and chaos in my head but not transcendent. I felt like puking a few times but didn't. I would always expect puking though and have a bucket ready, just to be sure. It was really relaxed and lasted satisfyingly long but not too long to freak me out. I definitely recommend this. As i said, the syrian rue was a little disgusting, but totally worth it.

Oh no, you need to understand, that the very reason why vaped DMT only lasts 15 Minutes is because mono amine oxidases are in your whole body and when you flood your system with DMT via the lungs, while it does bypass the digestive system which acts as kind of a buffer, it's still actively broken down by MAOs in your blood amp; brain. So if you smoke MAOIs, the vaped DMT won't be broken down as quickly.
Yes you should, Also, smoke the MAOIs before the DMT like at least 2 or 3 minutes prior

I don't know how ayahuasca is. But to me it's like a normal DMT trip, it just doesn't wear off. So you blast off and have this intense expierience but it just doesn't stop. Seemingly. After time you'll notice it wearing off. The amount of MAOIs does determine the length of the expierience, however, the more you smoke the stronger the negative effects and risks become. It does affect your serotonin so if you mess it up too much you might have negative side effects. When it comes to puking, i usually enjoy puking because it gets rid of 85% of the sick feeling. But i don't have to every time. It depends on how much harmala extract you smoke and what is in your stomach. I haven't experimented enough with it already to say what exactly determines whether you need to or not. But if you feel like it, i recommend doing it. I still want to try 1g syrian rue tea because the 3 grams messed me up. Drinking MAOIs (harmalas are RIMAs btw, they're not as dangerous) apparently makes them stick around longer. WRITING.TITLE: Overwhelming ego death on 500ug 1P-LSD
WRITING.TEXT: There isn't really that much to this trip report but i still feel the need to share this. So i always took lower doses and really like the body feel and the visuals. I think i was generally going for "having a good time". But this time i obviously took more and i feel like i had my first proper ego death. And now i know why people say it's scary. The comeup was very very scary and intense at one point but as i "arrived" in the mindset i gained a self again, a slightly altered tripping self, but myself. The visuals were great but as i smoked weed at the peak i lost my self and the ability to appreciate the trip with that. I lost absolute control over my thoughts and everything went by on it's own in my head. Of course i thought i fucked up my brain. Apparently i remember digging up some deep and maybe dark shit about myself and my life which i don't remember and which was very painful. I kept telling myself that i must stop trying to find my ego and "let go" but it was impossible to do so because i just became a computing machine. The visuals were so intense that the closed eye visuals overlayed reality when i opened my eyes and closed and open eyes felt the same to me. I started freaking out and kept beating myself up, i think for not being able to let go. And the worst thing is that i had absolutely no control. After freaking out too much and the ego death not going away and me not being as patient as i wanted to i took trip killers. Ones you buy in pills in the netherlands which sold publicly and labeled "Trip stoppers" and i think which are for 2 people. But i took all of them. Then going to bed to best of my ability i noticed they weren't working and kept telling myself they will. After what felt way too long i started getting the sleepy vibes as you would expect from a fuck ton of Xanax. And my brain and body were in a sleep state but underneath it i could still feel the trip going on with full intensity. SO I DIDN'T ACTUALLY EVER FALL ASLEEP. Eventually i noticed that the weed high went away and that reality formed again. But i was wide awake. Then i beat myself up over taking trip killers even though they apparently just calmed me down and didn't really kill the trip. I thought that A) it is a shame that i took a trip killer because you're not supposed to end that enlightening expierience and B) now i actually damaged/messed up my brain by taking a harmful tripkiller. I noticed i couldn't sleep. And so i panicked over the thoughts i had about the trip killers. I opened my eyes and it felt like dreaming so i thought i was in delirium and REALLY messed up my brain. I couldn't sleep for the next 8 hours I eventually, after alot of mental stress and with calming music, got 1 hour of sleep in. Waking up i was still far from myself and tried distracting myself and tried sleeping over and over which was still nearly impossible. My mental capabilities were still extremely limited. I looked depressed to my grandma. I eventually got a bit of sleep here, a bit of sleep there and then at night a bit here and there and i feel like eventually around 5 to 7 AM at night (the next night after the trip mind you) i regained the ability to sleep easier. Now it's 11 AM and i feel like myself again. This was a horrible trip for me. In retrospect i feel like i shouldn't have taken the tripkillers but in that moment i was very close to freaking out that i would've taken a bullet if i could've. I was home alone. Big mistake.

Maybe. I know that what i now wanna do is go after my goals no matter how depressed i am some days and no matter how lazy i am and no matter how pointless they seem. And yeah i am very glad now to be sober. I just hope the trip and the tripkillers won't leave any long-term damage.
Fuchsrehchen is a fitting name :^)

WRITING.TITLE: I have a difficult time understanding my mind
WRITING.TEXT: Notify me if this is the wrong subreddit. So, i have been doing alot of psychedelics recently. DMT here, Mushrooms once and LSD often during the last year. But ever since a DMT trip in September, whenever i take psychedelics i feel like nothing has meaning anymore and i feel really depressed and as if i have some sort of psychotic mental illness. I have been smoking alot of weed too but just got rid of the daily use of that and started to focus on stuff again and work out. I have been depressed with the "pointlessness" until recently when i started focusing and working out again. Now i feel great and everything in sober life makes sense and has meaning. I just did DMT and the same thing came back to me, making me feel like i won't i understand the world anymore, like nothing has meaning and very depressed. Luckily, i came back to myself. But i am still very curious what it is. Could it be that this is a kind of "if you get the message, hang up the phone" kind of thing? Could it be that i overused psychedelics? Or is it simply the withdrawal of weed combined with psychedelic use? I'd like to hear some ideas and maybe stuff from people with similar expieriences.

Okay, i know it's my task to define meaning. But what you need to do that is motivation and inspiration. And when psychedelics devoid me of all meaning and joy, there is literally nothing anymore. Funnily though, weed is the thing giving me back meaning whenever i'm on it. I'm amazed about everything and remember why i'm here.

Well, i was never big on not being myself, at least i think. Whenever i'm joyous i feel like myself. Whenever i appreciate everything and am amazed about everything just focusing on something instead of dwelling on the mysteries of existance. I mean i feel like working out and doing things, learning, playing, getting things done and such are what makes me happy. But when i have this existencial depression NOTHING seems appealing anymore

Yes. I also feel like this depression and pointlessness i get from psychedelics is a direct sign. Because losing my happiness about myself is one of the worst things ever for me. And i think i won't touch them again. Weed on the other hand i've been addicted to. Smoking it every day. After quitting it for some time i rediscovered that waiting it out and focusing on something is what keeps me happy. I want a healthy relationship with it, showing me whenever i do smoke it that things arent too bad. I wanna try a healthy relationship with it. But i will keep away from psychedelics for now

I think hanging up the phone for now is the best idea and getting absorbed in life. Because honestly thats what many trips told me already. To LIVE life and not try to be outside of it all the time. I will try to get myself to do what i promised myself and what i'm ambitious for. Part of that is a healthy relationship with cannabis. If the periods between my highs make me depressed again, i'll quit.

I feel like forgetting the pointlessness is the most productice thing i can do. Keeping it at bay with the rush of getting stuff done and working out and weed and reaching for my goals. I will try out different things and see how they work and try to forget the pointlessness. I will get psychological help if nothing works because at that point i'll have to accept that i'm one of those people who have depression or some sort of disorder.

I think it's because they dissolve boundaries and make everything lose its meaning. I don't think making everyone feel like me would be productive, honestly; i think it would advocate suicide without positive thoughts even if they may be lies.
I'll try not using them for now. Like nah mate

WRITING.TITLE: Depersonalization induced by DMT
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, i'm a 20 year old male and i've been doing DMT for a year now, LSD multiple times and Shrooms once too. I only ever did low dose DMT trips which were fun and eye opening towards to beauty of the world. However, on one DMT trip i felt like something cracked and i felt depersonalized on it. On a prior post i made i said it felt like i now "induced mental illness". Ever since that trip i felt disconnected from everything from time to time or everything just seemed boring. WRITING.TITLE: What the fuck is even going on
WRITING.TEXT: So, long story short, i smoked DMT alot of times, low doses, and one day it felt like something in my head cracked. After that i had derealization episodes for the last 3 weeks where i lose all joy about everything and don't see a point in life anymore, which have been going away more and more recently. Still, i just had one again and i noticed that it's not just derealization. I also for some reason need to pee alot more whenever i feel like that and my coordination also gets disoriented. I start having more pseudo hallucinations and sleeping becomes very confusing and worrying as it feels like my brain is shutting down but I, the one thinking, is still as conscious as when i am awake. It almost feels like something is not shutting up OR something causing signals that really aren't meant to be, similar to how sleeping feels on acid where you have to consciously not think. I made alot of these posts, i know, but i'm still confused and looking for something to explain this and wondering if i'm the only person ever expieriencing this.
I am smoking weed but whenever i do it either intensifies the derealization OR keeps it away. I smoked everyday last week until yesterday and yesterday evening it hit me through the night.
It's like i'm overly aware whenever i'm asleep.
And it causes uncontrollable panic. Which is weird, because i'm a "chill" guy.

Yes that too. But very different from when for example i'm troubled by something. It's like as i descent into sleep, i feel everything in my mind feeling weird and then me still being there and starting to think alot which makes me awake again, as if something wants to keep me from sleeping.

Yeah well, no shit am i trying to not think ^^ I meditate sometimes. Doing mindful meditation. One time last week i think, i was in such a trans like state and when meditating suddenly i felt a strong shift and and there was like some weird visual effect that looked like shutters of a window. They appeared shortly after which i felt weird. Yes, i had a traumatic 500ug 1P-LSD expierience where i took trip killers one week before the last time i did DMT.
DMT? Sometimes a few times a week and then like 2 or 4 weeks break because i had to make more

I don't know except that i won't touch that stuff for a few months, quit weed for some time soon and then after some time make NEW DMT and clean my vaporizer and then try it again and if it happens again then well fuck me No psychedelics for me anymore.

WRITING.TITLE: My entire mind is fake
WRITING.TEXT: Recap: So i have been someone who loved life for the last year and was happy he was alive since life IS a gift. No matter what i was doing, i was glad i was doing it. But then at some point whenever i wasn't smoking weed, and i've been addicted to it for like 5 months, i felt lifeless, everything felt grey and tiresome. I took DMT in that time, suddenly it felt like my mind cracked and everything inside it felt upside down and out of order. After that i took 500 ug of 1P-LSD, a trip that made me feel like everything in my life so far went wrong and that it's all directly my fault and that i am worth nothing. Standard stuff. Just couldn't go to sleep for 3 days and i was barely functional. Then i took DMT a week later and that cracking again just that after that felt like coming out of a DMT trip again and again, where everything seems pointless and i'm stuck in my mind. Weed didn't change anything it just either made me feel good when i wasn't feeling like that or EVEN MORE like that. 2 weeks i decided to take a weed break due to this. Now this is interrupted by periods where i feel normal again during the week. Where i feel like i re-learn things about life i already knew before and start feeling like a human again with human feelings and human problems. I get things like life is actually beautiful and typical stuff that motivates me to be alive again. Just too bad that completely at random i get sucked back into that trance like state that feels like coming out of a trip, where my thinking gets messy, i start having pseudo closed eye visuals, i lose all hope, everything becomes tiresome and pointless and i seemlingly forget everything i learned and it really annoys me that my mind is no longer my own and nothing i do or think matters in any way. I did homework early because i wanna play PC Games again? Too bad, you won't be able to enjoy it because you're gonna be in your weird state again! And it's not that just like addictive "bad habits" like video games, weed, food, masturbation, etc. lose their appeal, also forming good habits like working on my university stuff, meditating or working out become tiresome. And i'm just so angry that i can't even trust my own mind anymore which is really not helpful when i'm trying to do my homework for university. I'm getting lots of sleep, sometimes wake up confused in the middle of the night. I tried to stay positive all the time telling myself i'll be fine and that things aren't so bad but that gets obliterated again and again at random and i'm just so done. I hate this. Every time it happens it's almost like a reset to the post-trip mindset. I wish i could tell myself that it'll be better and i mean compared to before it has been fading and my mind is more stable. But i still don't know if i can do this and am, if anything, extremely pissed that something constantly makes me wanna kill myself. I just posted this because at the moment my mind feels the need to complain. In 2 days i'll think about this and think that this was pointless and didn't help me in any way, but still felt the need to share for some reason.
It's torturing me again and again though. I don't know if i will ever be normal again

Thank you so much! It almost feels like they do occur less often. I mean i've been having discount version of them throughout the week where my world started to feel really small sometimes and things a bit boring, however, recently it's been hitting me hard again over the last 2 to 3 days. However, i still notice differences to how they were some time ago. Just whenever they do happen, i things seem incredibly hopeless. I really hope they will go away after time.

Oh i think im hyper observing. I don't even feel i'm in it at all. I feel so outside of myself sonetimes you wouldn't believe. I'd rather be addicted than this. But this is what i got. Which is why i stopped smoking weed daily after doing so for 4-5 months and try to stop other things. And honestly, it's not so hard when nothing makes you happy. I can only ever rarely distance myself from my feelings and observe them.

Then again, if i really will ever be normal again, i wanna use this opportunity to better my outside life. Even if it means nothing to me sometimes. The times it does mean something, it does feel great.
What do you mean long time...? I mean i can imagine quite a long time like a year or so
Yeah... i'll try to manage. This hella sucks but... well, i guess i have no other choice...
I'm trying, but whenever i do realise something it gets crushed again. I guess at the end i'll know way more than when i started but it's still horrifying this cold loneliness
Thought so too. In my case i seem to have to get beat down and rise a hundret times to ascend or something

They really used to strengthen it until i took it too far. Beating my ego up with psychedelics while mentally weakening myself with my weed addiction was really self-destructive. But you're right! I will continue no matter what. If anything this has shown me how strong i can be. This shit is an unimaginable force but i'll fight it! Somehow.

I'll probably forget this on an emotional level next time it hits me and all the strength i gained until then will be lost. But i'll still push through. Cause this is MY mind and i'm not subjected to it. It is subject to me! Well, my ego but my ego is me.

The only time my ego is gone will be when i'm dead. And anyone who thinks they don't have an ego have the biggest one. I've seen myself without an ego and it's just me imagining things in infinite loops with no coherence of thought whatsoever. The place i'm at in my life with my 20 years, i NEED an ego. Otherwise i will have no reason to do anything anymore.

I didn't say you had a big one, just said people who claim to have none have the biggest. I got that from wise man PsychedSubstance So my true self is the thing telling me that nothing is worth doing and life is not worth living? And the thing that motivates me to love everything and be creative and compassionate is my bad evil ego? I don't understand.

No no with outside i meant everything that isn't inside my mind. I've been doing more homework, getting stuff done and getting rid of bad habits. But sometimes you know... my mind just starts hating me again...

I wish i could feel normal human emotions all the time. But all i feel is this pointlessness, motivationlessness, depression, nothingness anxiety and panic. I wish my feelings were based off of outside conditions. I would love that. But something happened. Something that made me not feel and be outside of myself. I just get this emptiness whenever "it" happens. Right now i feel good again. But how i feel is basically pretty much a constantly spinning gambling wheel throughout the day.
I have that view and it makes me sad sometimes because nothing has any meaning
And then drop it as you blast off

I would say no because psychedelics either make you think everything you know is fake or they make you more delusional depending on how certain beliefs of yours are stored in your brain. What happened during tripping? He was even more condescending. Not very empathetic. I was faced with existencialism and got convinced that nothing anyone does has any meaning, no one does anything for a good reason, all relationships are fake and we all just do certain things for no reason other than what the chemical reactions inside us dictate us to do. I've had really bad existencialism and DP/DR since my last trip. Because if everything i ever thought or felt doesn't matter, the negative emotions just like the positive ones, if they are all just fake, why would anything matter? If i feel like doing something i just observe it as a random thought and give it no value. All my passions are nothing. All my goals are nothing. My friends, my relationships, my emotions, all amount to nothing and as i can observe my life itself, it also amounts to nothing because nothing in it amounts to anything. Yeah i've been having a really rough time where i've been having flashbacks to my last trip and everything i used to love became tiresome and everything i ever wanted became unappealing and life itself became unappealing. But as sober time passes i come back. Things are nice again and i enjoy being a person. And whenever i feel negative emotions i tell myself that they'll and that i feel them for a reason. Whenever i feel something i don't want to feel i observe it, but whenever i feel something i want to feel, i engage into it. Because i believe we are here to love and feel. I know that nothing that i think is my true self, but rather my thoughts which i also don't have any control over in a sense. I think i've gone waay too meta and need to find myself back into my life because i've been feeling nothing but existencialism and dread the last couple of weeks. And whenever i did feel something that actually had to do with my life and my situation i was glad. No matter what emotion it was if it was a normal human emotion like anger or fear or envy or happiness or passion, i was glad whenever i did feel them. Being something is so much better than being nothing and i don't know why i'm telling you this but i feel like it's my ego needing to vent of it's frustration from the last couple of weeks.
I guess i'll find out.
Thought LOOP??? This more looks like total chaos. Which i remember
300ug to 500ug 1P after smoking too much

Well, i feel like weed makes my core state more pure. And actually, my core state is altered after psychedelics. So, evenever i smoked weed i kinda got nice trippy thoughts and loved everything about life and had implicit visuals. Though, after my last trips, i had this feeling of not being myself, total chaos in my head, and depersonalization/derealization. In a sober state that is. Weed only intensified that. Sleeping did too. But when i felt good, weed gave a similar satisfaction to sleeping. I think your core mind gets intensified. When sober you have alot of assisting mechanisms like high-level programs improving system stability and even performance. But when you smoke weed, most of those get disabled and you expierience more of your core. Which is why i also think it intensifies tripping. The things that your brain uses to tell itself about reality, like certain error corrections that account for the total chaos caused by the drug, get disabled and you get to expierience more of that chaos. Hence why it intensifies the trip.

Depends on what stage of "psychedelic recovery" i am. My last psych usage raped my brain so bad that i had depersonalization and derealization and general chaos in my head, negative emotions, etc. Of course my mind was hurt a needed time to rebuild itself. During that time, weed just made it worse. Now i mostly feel great actually after this very hard phase and i haven't tried weed for a month yet but i imagine it being amazing now again. Because i remember having such a phase after lighter trips, after which the weed was amazing.
Nah not really. I still wanna do what makes me happy. Which is being naked in nature and be thankful for all of existance. But also having a cool vape.
Cheers. We are just monkeys made of accumulated dirt in the universe. It is not our place to understand all. But a part of it. And that part is what we learn in our lives.

We are not arch angels, we are just monkeys who got optimized more and more by natural selection. We are the product of the universes rules. Still, we are but fishes in a river. We do not know it's destiny, we only know we are in it. We have always been in this river and always will be. Hence we cannot imagine the ocean.
It's a product of our specific wiring.

Because they realised profound things and chose to believe them. Profound expieriences can have a really heavy impact on a humans psyche. Bad aswell as good. They make them strong either way because they make them think about things alot.

Okay, i never had a job, am 20 and never had a gf but do have friends. I did alot of drugs (DMT, LSD and weed) often out of curiosity, boredom and to lighten my mood. It broke my brain and gave me, i wouldn't say a mental illness, but rather like a mental "cold" for a bit less than 2 months. WRITING.TITLE: DMT caused me 2 months of terrible mental health and DP/DR and now i'm scared of it
WRITING.TEXT: I often wrote here that i've been doing low dose DMT for some time, like 6 months, and at one point after a while of doing alot of weed, LSD and DMT (not at once but like in general), a DMT trip caused me to have depersonalization and derealization for 2 months and it's only been going away steadily which has been a long and rocky road. I'm very afraid of losing my mind now. Yesterday i took a puff that didn't even cause visuals and it got me confused and panicking. It also made me sure that i wouldn't do DMT for another 5 months. Though, i think i'm gonna have to go there and face the fear of going insane huh? Any tips, given my situation?

With a dry herb vaporizer and with paper tower so that the melting dmt would be absorbed. Impossible to reach high intake with that thing, airflow waaay too restricted. Uhh... sometimes multiple times a month, but definitely every month!

But like i had such great expieriences for so long and it was always great for my mental health. I'm just pissed why all of the sudden i'm not allowed to have that expierience anymore. And then after 6 months suddenly "Poof!"? I mean okay if i now messed up my brain and induced a mental illness all of the sudden, then sure. I guess i'll never take psychedelics again and see a psychologist. Just don't know what to tell them when i'm there. About all the symptoms that i had? About how i feel in general? Like, the symptoms have been fluctuating and going away so much, to me it feels like they're as good as gone. I guess i'll just tell them everything.
I mean i feel pretty alright. Just got like this tiny bit of existencialism somewhere back there

Yeah well the only posts i made were about my mental problems because that was literally the only reason i came here. That and furry subreddits. I gotta say, at the moment i feel pretty connected with reality and myself and feel pretty sane. Or, well, not much less sane than i did before that expierience. All i know is that i wanna stay away from psychedelics. Like, when i expierienced that, i just thoight "okay, i gotta give my mind a break from all that exploring" You gotta imagine, i did LSD, DMT, weed and shrooms every month i was convinced that i could only become happy by using those substances. How stupid.

I actually said for myself that i'm truly ready again when i have been feeling ready for multiple months Like, if at one point i feel i'm really stable and ready and everything for psychedelics, THEN i'll wait another few months to really make the paint dry, you know?
Absolutely, it's all in our heads.
Makes me think Hallucinated worlds are actually just 1/4 of the rendered world mirrored 2 times
That looks as if you reached the far lands and things really start to go down
Amazing

Interesting. Yeah no weed has been very scary for the last two months. I couldn't enjoy it. It would make the dissociation worse. Which is one of the reasons i took a break and only came back to it recently. You know, i can wait i don't need psychedelics at the moment. Weed is good enough and being sober is amazing too. Recently i've been feeling better and i know it for a fact because weed became more comfortable again. I enjoy it again. Visuals do not scare me. That's a big change. At this point i have trouble telling if i'm even dissociating at all. I don't feel like it. Existing isn't pain anymore. It's a blessing again.
I almost feel like i induced a mental "cold". A psychosis i guess? It's definitely going away though.

I just continued through it in hope it will go away. That switch got fixed recently though i feel. I feel like this is a mental function you use on multiple subconscious level and without it subconscious things don't make so much sense
Right?!?!?

I had this situation just recently. I try to be an occasional smoker and just smoke when i feel like it. And then i was like "Okay, today was nice, now i don't need it anymore." and then i found excuses to also to it the next day. And the next. And the next. What i did then was say "Okay, you know what. I will now PLAN to smoke EVERY DAY until sunday MAX. I can quit before, but it's kind of 'booked/reserved' and okay to smoke until sunday and after that i'll take a 1 week break, preferrably 2 weeks." So i smoked every day and after every high i thought "I don't need this. I'm gonna quit now already!". I did end up smoking every day until that set DEADLINE sunday. Especially since it made the whole thing feel complete. And, what do you know, i quit on sunday 8 days ago. The following week was hell but here i am feeling much better, ready to go another week. Hope this can help in some way

Also, you're just weak because you believe you are. You're actually in control but you choose to continue. And you have your internal reasons. Remember that. I believe once you believe there "is something inside you that makes you do this" you start believing that you can't change it. Don't give up! Even if you fail so many times, even if you feel worse and worse, if you keep wanting to quit, in the long run you'll end up quitting. You can do it! And if your addiction makes you smoke more then try leaning into it, intensifying the feeling of how much you hate binge smoking, motivating you even more to get out. Yes it can be hard, but just go with it. Feel like shit. There is light at the end of that tunnel, even if you can't see it. My withdrawals always remind me of the harry potter scene with the potion of despair where dumbledore rather kills himself than keep drining that poison, even if drinking it all up will make it stop. He despairs in the moment. Just keep walking. At the end you will find joy in everything again without smoking, less need to smoke at every opportunity, and great highs whenever you do decide to smoke again and believe you can keep the addiction at bay.

Fuck yeah. Just a fair warning, that might go away the next few days as more and more cannabinoids leave your system. My body always needs time to rebalance my endocannabinoids and regenerate the receptors, leaving me feeling empty for the 3rd to 7th day. Like it will come back and you will feel even better, but don't get bummed when it's suddenly gone for a few days. It might just stay but you will find out.

WRITING.TITLE: Status Report: this 1 month break has been great so far
WRITING.TEXT: I really did struggle alot at the beginning and i didn't take off smoothly, but as of recently my life and mood have been starting to lighten up. I'm almost 2 weeks in now and don't really feel a need to smoke and start to have interest in doing things again. Even doing things i only considered fun when high. Things gained their magic back, even without weed intensifying it. That's also something i felt; as if weed seems to burn all that joy at once and at some point it's just all burned up, making me feel empty. It's good until a certain point. I still have 10g of super strong stuff (for my low tolerance anyways, 0.1 get me super high) laying around and love smelling it but have no interest of smoking it, because randomly doing so almost seems like a waste of a high, especially during this break. I even rolled a few spliffs for someone and did fantasize about trying them, but of course didn't want to at all because i felt so good because of this break : gt;. Also i hate tobacco so that was a turn-off. (Usually smoke with a tobacco substitute) Another thing i noticed, since this isn't my first attempt at a break, is that getting out of a weed binge/addiction isn't JUST about staying away from the drug, it's also about staying away from bad thoughts. I have to constantly pull myself up again when a random mood hits me and gets me depressed. So it isn't just the chemical part that plays a role here, at least for me, but also a psychological component. However, i think the most interesting part will be keeping this kind of relationship up once i allow myself to smoke again. That will be a whole 'nother challange by itself and i'm interested in how it'll turn out this time. That's all, hope you have a great day!

I'd personally add a rule that makes you only have a high when you feel it is justified. But then again, that's a dangerous rule since that is subject to subjectivity. I think you can do it and even if you don't, you'll prolly catch yourself and make new ones that work better.
Exactly, there is no obligation to smoke. The more casual and occasional the less of an addiction it is, the healthier the use!

Very much. The funniest thing is sometimes when i take a long break, the first high is strong but weird and the next ones after that are magical because i kinda "believe them", leaving me feeling great even without smoking and then after a longer while it makes me depressed. I think the highs have to do with your mindset and subconcious AND they affect those two such that the highs can get better or worse all the time.

That's cause your brain is completely tripped out on withdrawals/change of chemical balance. It learned to function with an overflow of cannabinoids and suddenly there are way too little. If you're just a little stupid then i'd say you have very mild withdrawals then, they can be way worse. Another theory is of course that the cannabis made you a bit dumber over the years but only now you notice it. Only being sober for longer will give you the answer! ^^

Sounds great! Word of caution though: Cutting back from daily use to weekly CAN cause constant withdrawals inbetween because in the time where you're not smoking withdrawals set in, then you smoke, then you don't, withdrawals, repeat, making your only state of mind either be high or on withdrawals. !! I DON'T KNOW IF THIS WILL HAPPEN TO YOU, YOU HAVE TO TRY AND SEE. !! If this happens to you however, you can try getting to that rythm from the other side. Quitting for a certain time (at least a month) and then increase to only weekends might help.

Relate. Totally. 1000%. Been there. And honestly, one of the things i learned is that it's not so easy to just quit (for a break) without feeling like shit. But being this hard on myself never helped me. I found it's better taking the stance of "this is something hard, and i'm working on it and i can do it, it's just hard" rather than "this should be easy, how am i so weak?" because it doesn't take my strength from me when i keep believing in myself. Don't be so hard on yourself but also don't forget the problem. Know that you need to quit but be aware that that isn't an easy thing. Looking back, i was only able to quit after picking it up again. Gave me strength somehow. I did 2 weeks, fell into addiction again and went through some mental work before finally deciding that i would do it. Even then i had a dilemma at the beginning because there were really good reasons to smoke again while the break was still young but ultimately i didn't do it. At some point it's just not worth it to "break" your break anymore, you know? Also i know the feeling of not being sure if you can ever enjoy things again, but trust me, if you just keep weed off your TODO list and come up with things you wanna do, you will soon find a new, more sustainable joy that comes from inside. And you will relearn what it means to have lows and what it means to be bored and all that stuff and learn how to not let those moods get to you too much. You'll also rediscover old feelings. Also if you don't feel like doing anything, don't. Go easy on yourself. You can do it!

Yeah and the thing is, everyone is different and everyone has to learn how to deal with themselves. There usually isn't one clear recipe on how to do things like that. You have to figure out how you work with regards to that addiction and never stop trying or lose hope. Eventually, you'll find a way or something will motivate you to do the thing you want.

And i totally get the peer thing. And hey, i was super critical of myself regardless. "Look at me, my bestie is having real problems of having cheated on his girlfriend due to lack of self-control and being in total drama with that relationship while i'm just here in my little basement struggling to even quit weed." Everyone has their own problems and for everyone different things are differently difficult.
Failing and learning how your mind works is part of figuring yourself out and finding out how to work with yourself.

Usually it feels like there is nothing left to live for in my life and that nothing is fun or exciting anymore and my drive usually goes nowhere except smoking and taking drugs. It also feels like my entire personality is just shit and fake and all the magic for everything is gone. I forget what i am or my life is about, my goals seem undesirable, everything feels tiring aaaand... hm i don't feel alive or present anymore. Kind of... "offline". And ugly parts of my personality show themselves and everything is overshadowed by existencialism, constantly thinking about how life is just torture accompanied by the need for a dopemine rush. Which isn't what life is of course but it is when all i do is get high.

Well it's our brain adapting to the high levels of cannabinoids, numbing receptors to prevent over stimulation. The result is that in different parts of the brain where the endocannabinoid system is prevalent, can't listen to it's own neurotransmitters anymore because it's SO numbed, causing us to not "feel ourselves" anymore. Gets fixed by keeping endocannaboid stimulation too low by just keeping cannabinoid levels natural after the system adapted to high cannabinoid levels.

I don't know what your issue is. You'll have to try. I know that in MY case those feelings went away AFTER TIME once i quit smoking for a while (after around 1.4 Weeks) and then feel pretty good after a month and am then able to feel great and get really nicely (and really fucking) high by keeping it moderate. Only smoking every once in a while. It helped me to find my sober center again and keep being high as kind of a thing i do that gives me exciting thoughts and is fun but not something i need and now when i encounter those feelings i know what they are, even tho they still feel very real. I mistook those feelings for genuine depression before and thought i'd have to use psychedelics to get the meaning back in my life. Which then hugely backfired and caused me a 6 month depersonalized psychosis all while being on these existencialistic depressing withdrawal and while-high anxious feelings. Like holy shit wtf XD But yeah i remember a quote from Dennis McKenna from a Joe Rogan podcast where he says he gets emails of people saying like "You know life's been kinda strange lately, i took mushrooms 5 times last week..." and he says something along the lines of lay off the sauce, whatever it is that you're taking and see if THAT'S what is causing YOUR problems. Link: https://youtu.be/QcLa9IFQFak But yeah it has helped me. Not instantly because mentally i was in a pretty deep hole but i felt myself return more and more with each break i took.

And whenever i oversmoke now and start to feel bad again i'll take a few days break or like a week and if that doesn't do it i'll just do a month and that will usually do it. At least the current data i have collected on myself would suggest that. But getting to this level of control took alot of time and work. I had to fail to moderate and lose control and slowly regain it to understand the importance of this. Never give up trying this. Was a real hassle but apparently worth it.
Also during the 6 months on derpersonalization, psychosis and weed withdrawal i was doing my first computer science semester, having forgotten why i'm even interested in it. Like holy shit wtf XD

Ay if you wanna we can stay in touch. It is a very wild journey most people don't know even exists because not everyone expieriences it, everyone thinks weed withdrawals aren't real and/or the mega stoners just keep ignoring themselves and keep smoking more and more to silence the worries.

WRITING.TITLE: I don't know what is happening but i like it.
WRITING.TEXT: So... last Thursday i wanted to stop. I didn't smoke on friday but felt urges and was unmotivated aswell on saturday. Then i smoked again because a friend wanted to. Then on sunday i was upset and really fighting with myself until letting go and saying "Fuck it" and just go crazy with the weed. Smoked ALOT and got really fucking high, so high even that i saw stars that weren't there, it's crazy. At the end of the day i felt like i could totally keep going like this but then thought "Nah lets end it tomorrow. Every relapse is part of the progress and maybe i need to be in the exact situation i will be tomorrow." So then next day i was really content and relaxed and didn't have any cravings. I did feel like "Yeah, smoking would be pretty awesome right now." but didn't really get to it and didn't really want to. At the end of the day, where cravings usually get the most intense and i the most lazy, i started becoming really hyperactive and suddenly wanted to do everything i usually do when sober. Work out, do music, play games, etc. And i didn't wanna smoke at all. Infact my head went, and still is going, so crazy and wild, i was so motivated, it almost got scary, even now, i don't know if i could handle any drugs rn. It feels like my brain is super charged and it's a little scary but i'll go with it and take this opportunity.

The thing is... same? Last times i took a break i was feeling way more unproductive?? Like it's the same chaotic vibe in my head it almost feels like instead of going to nihilistic existencialistic thoughts it's just making me act like i'm on meth or something haha
